pair.value: CTMS View Claim - This allows users to view a claim inquiry on a site payment.
Wait for task report to update
Wait for task report to update

timer-trigger.name: Wait for task report to update

acp.name: Subject
acp.a:expr: =#"_a-0000ddcb-815e-8000-daab-640000640000_18404"(pv!claim.responseUsername)&" has responded to the claim raised against paymnent: "&pv!claim.paymentIdentifier

acp.name: ae-key-CLAIM
acp.a:expr:
="Site Details
Site Identifier: "&pv!sitePayment.siteId&"
Site #: "&pv!site.siteNumber&"
Contract Amount: "&pv!site.contractAmount&"
Status: "&pv!site.siteStatus&"
IRB Approval Date: "&pv!site.irbApprovalDate&"
Site Initiated: "&pv!site.siteInitiated&"
Site Terminated: "&pv!site.siteTerminated&"

Payment Details
Payment #: "&pv!sitePayment.paymentNumber&"
Protocol #: "&pv!sitePayment.protocolsNumber&"
Region: "&pv!sitePayment.region&"
Account: "&pv!sitePayment.accountName&"
PI Last Name: "&pv!sitePayment.piFirstName&"
PI First Name: "&pv!sitePayment.piLastName&"
Payee Account Name: "&pv!sitePayment.siteNumber&"
Earned Amount: "&pv!sitePayment.earnedAmount&"
Requested Amount: "&pv!sitePayment.requestedAmount&"
Paid Amount: "&pv!sitePayment.paymentAmount&"
Paid Date: "&pv!sitePayment.paidDate&"
Status: "&pv!sitePayment.paymentStatus&"
Payment Type: "&pv!sitePayment.paymentType&"
Transaction #: "&pv!sitePayment.transactionNumber&"
Transaction Type: "&pv!sitePayment.transactionType&"

Claim Details
Response By: "&#"_a-0000ddcb-815e-8000-daab-640000640000_18404"(pv!claim.responseUsername)&"
Response Date: "&pv!claim.responseDate&"
Decision: "&displayvalue( pv!claim.responseType, #"_a-0000dd3a-dada-8000-daab-640000640000_11228", #"_a-0000ddcb-815e-8000-daab-640000640000_18343", "" )&"
Comment: "&pv!claim.responseComment

uiExpressionForm.expression: =#"_a-0000dd3a-dada-8000-daab-640000640000_11282"( siteId: ac!siteId, userAction: ac!userAction, claim: ac!claim, formAction: #"_a-0000ddcb-815e-8000-daab-640000640000_18377" )

annotation.text: To ensure the task is generated before sending the email with task link, we wait, get the link, test if it's null, and repeat until not null. This ensures the task is generated and the link is valid.
This flow enables optional sending of email. This is important when a flow could be part of a process flow, or a user launched single event flow
